document:
<sentence id="s3" text="Therefore, we conducted genotyping for 17 SNPs of six positive regulation of cholesterol transport core genes (li>XPA, nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition, XPG, nucleotide-excision repair, ERCC2, and li>ERCC4) in 89 ovarian cancer cases and 356 cancer-free controls.">
<sentence id="s4" text="The result showed that both li>nucleotide-excision repair rs11615 and li>nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition rs2228000 were significantly associated with reduced risk of ovarian cancer under dominant genetic model (adjusted OR = 0.35, 95% CI = 0.20-0.61, li>P=0.0002 and adjusted OR = 0.49, 95% CI = 0.30-0.81, li>P=0.005 respectively).">
<sentence id="s5" text="In addition, li>nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition rs2228001 and li>ERCC2 rs238406 had statistically significant association with the increased risk of ovarian cancer under dominant genetic model (adjusted OR = 1.72, 95% CI = 1.02-2.92, li>P=0.043 and adjusted OR = 2.07, 95% CI = 1.07-4.01, li>P=0.032 respectively).">
<sentence id="s6" text="nucleotide-excision repair rs3212986 were related with the increased risk of ovarian cancer under recessive model (adjusted OR = 2.40, 95% CI = 1.30-4.44, li>P=0.005).">
<sentence id="s7" text="In conclusion, our results indicated that li>nucleotide-excision repair, nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition and li>ERCC2 might influence ovarian cancer susceptibility.">
